pullRequest.body:
(And also namespace and rename the lemmas about them.)

As discussed in the reviewers chatroom.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [fbe02d6286](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17618/commits/fbe02d6286849807f199d621782657e85a2a6865)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coprime_fermatNumber_fermatNumber`
`+ fermatNumber`
`+ fermatNumber_eq_prod_add_two`
`+ fermatNumber_one`
`+ fermatNumber_product`
`+ fermatNumber_two`
`+ fermatNumber_zero`
`+ odd_fermatNumber`
`+ strictMono_fermatNumber`
`+ two_lt_fermatNumber`
`- coprime_fermat_fermat`
`- fermat`
`- fermat_eq_prod_add_two`
`- fermat_one`
`- fermat_product`
`- fermat_two`
`- fermat_zero`
`- odd_fermat`
`- strictMono_fermat`
`- two_lt_fermat`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I think `Nat.fermat` is enough, unless there is something else named "Fermat" for natural numbers (perhaps Fermat pseudoprime?). This makes the name `Nat.coprime_fermatNumber_fermatNumber` too long IMHO.
Agree, `Nat.fermat` seems fine unless there's some clashing with the FLT project or something like that.

There's no clashing with FLT naming but I look at `Nat.fermat` and think "whatever does that mean?" whereas I look at `Nat.fermatNumber` and think "I know exactly what that will be" which is I think what we're aiming for.

Re "it's too long" -- it will also be never used, so this is fine. There's no big theory of Fermat numbers, I think I would rather argue "this shouldn't even be there" than "this should have a shorter name". Note that `2^2^n+1` is shorter than `Nat.fermat`. My instinct is just to merge this but if people really want to bikeshed about the name then feel free to do it here.

> I look at `Nat.fermat` and think "whatever does that mean?" whereas I look at `Nat.fermatNumber` and think "I know exactly what that will be" which is I think what we're aiming for.

That's fine. But for the same reason, [mersenne](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/NumberTheory/LucasLehmer.html#mersenne) should also be renamed, no? This probably should be in another PR.
I guess one difference is that Mersenne is not famous for anything else! So if I see `mersenne` I can guess what it is.

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11294667867/job/31415654933)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11294667867/job/31415655595)
This doesn't look right

Oops, nicely spotted!
```suggestion
theorem coprime_fermatNumber_fermatNumber {k n : ℕ} (h : k ≠ n) :
```
There is a typo.

Oh no, not again! 😬
```suggestion
- `Nat.coprime_fermatNumber_fermatNumber`: two distinct Fermat numbers are coprime.
```

More precisely
```suggestion
- `Nat.coprime_fermatNumber_fermatNumber`: two distinct Fermat numbers are coprime.
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(NumberTheory/Fermat): rename `fermat` to `Nat.fermatNumber`
